oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Slate Stone Horror
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: John Weatherford
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Slate Stone Horror a poem "Composed by John Weatherford, Coal Creek, Tennessee, who was at the scene of both Disasters, Fratersville (sic.) and Cross Mountain mines. Who has been in the house of every miner in Coal Creek and Briceville."
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Poetry; Mine accidents;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814.
